_meta.source: 38 CFR Part 4, Subpart B - Schedule of Ratings, Musculoskeletal System (Section 4.71a)

5003.name: Degenerative arthritis (hypertrophic or osteoarthritis)
5003.ratingMethod: Based on limitation of motion under appropriate DCs. If limitation is noncompensable, 10% for each major joint. X-ray evidence required.

ratings.20: X-ray evidence of involvement of 2 or more major joints with occasional incapacitating exacerbations
ratings.10: X-ray evidence of involvement of 2 or more major joints or 2 or more minor joint groups

ratings.100: For 1 year following implantation of prosthesis (mandatory minimum)
ratings.60: Chronic residuals consisting of severe painful motion or weakness in the affected extremity
ratings.30: Minimum rating after prosthesis replacement (intermediate degrees rated by analogy)

ratings.60: Extremely unfavorable, in flexion at an angle of 45 degrees or more
ratings.50: In flexion between 20 degrees and 45 degrees
ratings.40: In flexion between 10 degrees and 20 degrees
ratings.30: Favorable angle in full extension, or in slight flexion between 0 degrees and 10 degrees

5257.name: Recurrent subluxation or lateral instability
5257.note: Based on instability, NOT range of motion. Can be rated SEPARATELY from limitation of motion codes (VAOPGCPREC 23-97).

ratings.20: With frequent episodes of 'locking,' pain, and effusion into the joint

5260.name: Limitation of flexion of the leg

5261.name: Limitation of extension of the leg

5262.name: Impairment of the tibia and fibula

ratings.40: Nonunion, with loose motion, requiring brace
ratings.30: Malunion with marked knee or ankle disability
ratings.20: Malunion with moderate knee or ankle disability
ratings.10: Malunion with slight knee or ankle disability

importantRules.separateRatings: A veteran can receive SEPARATE ratings for instability (DC 5257) AND limitation of motion (DC 5260/5261) in the same knee per VAOPGCPREC 23-97 and 9-98. This is commonly missed by VA raters.
importantRules.separateFlexionExtension: Per VAOPGCPREC 9-2004, separate ratings can be assigned for limitation of flexion (DC 5260) and limitation of extension (DC 5261) of the same knee joint.
importantRules.bilateralFactor: If both knees are affected, the bilateral factor (38 CFR 4.26) adds 10% to the combined value of bilateral disabilities.
importantRules.painfulMotion: Per 38 CFR 4.59, painful motion of a major joint warrants at least the minimum compensable rating (10%) even if range of motion is technically full.
importantRules.flareUps: Examiners must estimate additional functional loss during flare-ups per DeLuca v. Brown and Sharp v. Shulkin.
